pandas>=1.3.0

# Computer vision and image processing
opencv-python>=4.5.0
Pillow>=8.0.0
ImageHash>=4.0.0

# Machine learning and deep learning
tensorflow>=2.8.0
# Note: GPU support is now included in tensorflow (no need for tensorflow-gpu)
scikit-learn>=1.0.0

# Data visualization
matplotlib>=3.3.0

# ============================================================================
# UTILITY LIBRARIES
# ============================================================================

# File handling and pattern matching
glob2>=0.7

# Model serialization and persistence
# Note: pickle is part of Python standard library

# Mathematical operations
math  # Built-in Python module

# System operations
os  # Built-in Python module
random  # Built-in Python module
warnings  # Built-in Python module

# Jupyter notebook support (for running .ipynb files)
jupyter>=1.0.0
ipykernel>=6.0.0
notebook>=6.4.0

# System and environment info (optional)
psutil>=5.8.0

# ============================================================================
# INSTALLATION NOTES
# ============================================================================

# To install all requirements:
# pip install -r requirements.txt

# For GPU support (if available):
# Ensure CUDA and cuDNN are properly installed on your system
# TensorFlow will automatically detect and use GPU if available

# For CPU-only installation (if you want to force CPU usage):
# pip install tensorflow-cpu>=2.8.0 instead of tensorflow

# Memory optimization:
# Consider installing with: pip install tensorflow-cpu if GPU is not needed
# to reduce memory footprint
